title: Nathan Brown (rugby league, born 1993)
text:
Nathan Brown (born 1 March 1993) is an <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Italian</a> international <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a for the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>.
He previously played for the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a> and the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a>, and <a href="City%20New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">NSW City</a> and the <a href="Prime%20Minister%27s%20XIII">Prime Minister's XIII</a> at representative level.
Background.
Brown was born in <a href="Fairfield%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Fairfield, New South Wales</a>, Australia. He is of <a href="Italian%20people">Italian</a> ancestry on his mother's side. Brown attended well renowned rugby league school <a href="Patrician%20Brothers%27%20College%2C%20Fairfield">Patrician Brothers' College, Fairfield</a> where he won MCS and state titles
He was a representative junior cricketer. He played his junior football for <a href="Farfield%20United">Farfield United</a>, <a href="Cabramatta%20Two%20Blues">Cabramatta Two Blues</a>,<a href="Five%20Dock%20RSL">Five Dock RSL</a> and <a href="Dundas%20Shamrocks%20Junior%20Rugby%20League%20Football%20Club">Dundas Shamrocks</a>, before being signed by the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a>.
Playing career.
Early career.
In 2012 and 2013, Brown played for the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a>' <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">NYC</a> team. On 30 September 2012, he played in the Tigers' <a href="2012%20NRL%20Under-20s%20season%20results%23Grand%20final">2012 NYC Grand Final</a> win over the <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a>. On 18 July 2013, he re-signed with the Tigers on a 3-year contract.
2013.
In Round 24 of the <a href="2013%20NRL%20season">2013 NRL season</a>, Brown made his <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> debut for the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a> against <a href="St.%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St. George Illawarra</a>. As <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a> had exceeded their second-tier salary cap, the <a href="NRL">NRL</a> had to grant a special dispensation for Brown to play as neither team could reach the semi-finals. However, Brown was precluded from playing in any further games for the season.
2015.
On 2 March, Brown signed a 2-year contract with <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney</a> effective immediately, after being released from his Wests contract. He made his South Sydney debut in round 6 of the <a href="2015%20NRL%20season">2015 NRL season</a> against <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland</a>. He finished off the year with seven games for Souths, starting in the second-row on two occasions.
2016.
Brown was a regular in first grade in 2016, playing prop or lock. In round 13 he avoided suspension after attempting to kick a player in the groin. The next week, he was described as, "one of rugby league’s dirtiest players, biggest thug and throwback to the old days," after a late shot on <a href="Mitchell%20Moses">Mitchell Moses</a>. Coach <a href="Michael%20Maguire%20%28rugby%20league%29">Michael Maguire</a> said, "Seriously I think he’s a good kid but he’s playing on the edge when fatigue sets in. He’s got to be more aware of those moments in the game." In September, Brown signed a 2-year contract with the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a> starting in 2017.
2017.
After a stellar first season with Parramatta, Brown was awarded the Ken Thornett Medal for being Parramatta's best player in 2017. Brown was named in the Italy training squad for the <a href="2017%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2017 Rugby League World Cup</a>. Brown played in all three of Italy's pool matches at the World Cup including the <a href="2017%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%20Group%20D">46-0</a> demolition of the <a href="United%20States%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">United States</a>.
2018.
On 6 March 2018, Brown signed a new contract to stay at Parramatta until the end of the <a href="2020%20NRL%20season">2020 NRL season</a>. In Round 5 against Penrith, Brown suffered an ankle injury in the 12-6 loss and was ruled out indefinitely. On 2 June 2018, Brown made his long-awaited return from injury in Parramatta's 30-4 defeat by Newcastle.
Brown made a total of 15 appearances for Parramatta as the club endured a horrid season finishing last on the table and claimed its 14th wooden spoon.
2019.
In round 1 2019 against the <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith Panthers</a>, Brown was taken from the field during the first half after damaging his left pectoral muscle. It was later revealed that Brown would be ruled out for 3 months.
Brown made his return to the Parramatta side against Cronulla-Sutherland in Round 13 which ended in a 42-22 loss at <a href="Shark%20Park">Shark Park</a>.
In Round 23 against arch rivals Canterbury-Bankstown, Brown was placed on report and sent to sin bin after hitting Canterbury player <a href="Dallin%20Watene-Zelezniak">Dallin Watene-Zelezniak</a> with an illegal shoulder charge. Parramatta would go on to lose the match 12-6 in a shock loss at the new <a href="Western%20Sydney%20Stadium">Western Sydney Stadium</a>. with Brown receiving a two match suspension. On 7 October, he was named in the Australian side for the <a href="2019%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%209s">2019 Rugby League World Cup 9s</a>.
2020.
On 13 May, Brown signed a contract extension with Parramatta, keeping him at the club until the end of the 2021 season.
Brown scored his first try of the year for Parramatta in the 2020 qualifying final against <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne</a> at <a href="Suncorp%20Stadium">Suncorp Stadium</a> where Parramatta lost 36-24.
Brown was selected for Game 2 and Game 3 of the <a href="2020%20State%20of%20Origin%20series">2020 State of Origin series</a> for New South Wales. The Blues would suffer a shock 2-1 series defeat against Queensland.
2021.
In round 19 of the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 NRL season</a>, Brown provided one of the bombed tries of the year. With the score in Canberra's favour 12-6, Parramatta put up a bomb which was caught by <a href="Jakob%20Arthur">Jakob Arthur</a>, he then passed it to Brown who dropped the ball unmarked right near the try line. Parramatta would go on to lose the game 12-10.
Brown made a total of 24 appearances for Parramatta in the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 NRL season</a> and played in both finals matches for the club as they were once again knocked out in the second week for a third straight season.
